Auditions for US contestants begin on 27 March in Los Angeles. Other sessions follow in Chicago, Dallas, Miami, Seattle and New York. Talking at a news conference Simon Cowell said: The top contestant will get$ 1 million( Â£ 619,000) a year for five years, separate from the costs involved in recording and promotion.`` It's a massive, massive risk but it's also an incredible incentive. It puts everybody, rightly, under an enormous amount of pressure.`` I believe I can find a star. But he admitted:`` If they don't sell a single record they still get to keep the money. It is pressure, because if the wrong person wins, I'm in trouble.

areas of concern. Mr Tony Blair responded by insisting that much of the government's position was publicly known.`` It was literally the issue the entire time,'' he insisted. The issue was being canvassed in Cabinet in the sense that the facts weren't really in dispute. Other documents which were released earlier this week showed Mr Tony Blair repeatedly downplayed and ignored legal advice warning against the ousting of Saddam Hussein . We found two of the eight missing artifacts outside the museum between a government building that got burned and the gift shop. We are continuing the search and will find more, Zahi Hawass told Reuters.
